intro: Alternanthera tucumana, commonly known as the Tucumán Alternanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that range in color from red to purple. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
